Articles.Content: I'm looking for some spaceflight related Halloween costumes. Anyone have any ideas? Astronaut is one that I already thought of, but I don't want to have to go out and buy a bunch of stuff. I also thought about Gene Krantz, but I don't know if anybody at my school will know who he is.

I quit it a long time ago; I got to the age where I was too old anyhow and my already small desire of candy tanked. What I'm trying to say I guess I that I don't know what's "in" when it comes to halloween costumes.

Do what I did for my final one: Wear your everyday clothes and call yourself an Average Citizen. I guarantee you'll get at least one laugh out of it.

Edited October 4, 2015 by Flymetothemun

Or I could say that I'm a new driver, an uneducated voter, etc, etc.

I do actually want to find a costume, but I want it to be space related.

A few good ones for under $100. You can get everything you need from here.

http://www.thespacestore.com/astronaut-costumes
Plague Doctor maybe
be a Kerbal.

A few good ones for under $100. You can get everything you need from here.

http://www.thespacestore.com/astronaut-costumes

They seem a little childish. Does anyone know what the websites of the NASA stores are? I can't find them.
make a cardboard spaceshuttle, sorta kinda like these but spacey
You know, that's not a bad idea. Where can I get a flight suit?

There.

There's a possibility stupid people will think you're a pencil, though.

What's wrong with a pencil? lol

I was once a Rubik's cube. Simple enough to make... a big box, square sheets of colored paper, glue. Only problem was at the party I went to, every time I sat down, my friends would come up and set their drinks down on me.

I quit it a long time ago; I got to the age where I was too old anyhow and my already small desire of candy tanked. What I'm trying to say I guess I that I don't know what's "in" when it comes to halloween costumes.

Do what I did for my final one: Wear your everyday clothes and call yourself an Average Citizen. I guarantee you'll get at least one laugh out of it.

Your post reminds me the episode of Community where "old" Pierce chooses to wear a Mark-Singer-as-the-Beastmaster costume to be "in" at the Halloween party.

---

Fun ideas in the Belgian comic book series "Gaston Lagaffe" by Franquin. There's a running joke about Gaston's eccentric costumes.

("Mais is on danse ?" = "But what if we dance?")

Your post reminds me the episode of Community where "old" Pierce chooses to wear a Mark-Singer-as-the-Beastmaster costume to be "in" at the Halloween party.

Spudnik.
I'm gonna be TARS
I'm gonna be TARS
I was a tourist a while ago. Loud Hawaiian shirt, sunglasses, shorts, flip-flops, and a camera.
I'm tall and skinny. So I do Nazgul type costume, when I bother at all nowadays. Mostly use the hood for backstage work at theatre productions now actually.

^

I'm too emaciated and got heavy bags under the eyes. This would look too ordinary for me. : )

---

Dman979, try a 2001 monolith costume. Cheap and easy. Big cardboard box, black paint, then stand still in the middle of the room.

EDIT : and shrill whenever you're under direct light (or want somebody to bring you a drink).

Edited October 4, 2015 by Plume & Akakak

^

I'm too emaciated and got heavy bags under the eyes. This would look too ordinary for me. : )

Dman979, try a 2001 monolith costume. Cheap and easy. Big cardboard box, black paint, then stand still in the middle of the room.

Put a SQUAD logo on it for bonus points.
Yea! That ^

Dman979, try a 2001 monolith costume. Cheap and easy. Big cardboard box, black paint, then stand still in the middle of the room.

Sounds like a party game if I ever heard of one.

"If you don't put your hands on me, it means you're not evolved."
VON BRAUN. That is all I have to say.

VON BRAUN. That is all I have to say.

that's one idea which I thought of, but I don't know how to make it work. I'd need a slide rule, but slide rules alone do not a rocket scientist make.

Last year I was a cucumber. Of course it rained as it does every single Halloween where I live and the costume couldn't be worn for more than twenty minutes. I put on a raincoat instead but then it turned to snow and I gave up and went in.

Save yourself $150, check this out http://www.instructables.com/id/Astronaut-Costume/

It's not as bad as you may think.

Here is another video I found. I've been looking into this as well. I'm probably going to try this one on youtube

If you change your mind, here are some other ideas you might find useful, whatever you decide, i'm sure you will enjoy. Good luck.
